buyMeal.subheader: Send Chinatown Love will connect merchants with local organizations that will distribute your gifted meals to a community in need.

buyMeal.explanationFirst: By gifting a meal, your donation will still go directly to the merchant.
buyMeal.explanationSecond: Our partners will then distribute vouchers with those who can benefit the most from a free meal.

merchantsPage.platformInfoDescription: We are providing an online platform to low-tech, cash-only, Asian-owned small businesses that have been disproportionately impacted by COVID-19.
merchantsPage.platformInfoAction: Support local merchants by making a donation or purchasing a voucher from them.
merchantsPage.flyerAsk: Know of any business owners that fit our target merchant?
merchantsPage.flyerDownload: Download our flyer to share with them.

disclaimer.donation: By proceeding with your transaction, you understand that you are making a donation to {{sellerName}}. No goods or services were exchanged for this donation.
disclaimer.donation_pool: By proceeding with your transaction, you understand that you are making a donation to all merchants partnered with Send Chinatown Love Inc. The full donation pool will be split among these merchants. No goods or services were exchanged for this donation.
disclaimer.gift_card: By proceeding with your purchase, you understand that the voucher card is not redeemable for cash and can only be used at {{sellerName}}. All purchases are final. In the event that the merchant is no longer open at the time of redemption, Send Chinatown Love Inc. will not be able to refund your purchase. Balance displayed in the voucher may or may not represent the final balance. Final balance information is subject to {{sellerName}} most recent records.
disclaimer.light_up_chinatown: By proceeding with your transaction, you understand that you are making a donation to the Light Up Chinatown Project. This Project is directed towards supporting Chinatown as a whole, rather than any individual merchant.
disclaimer.mega_gam: By proceeding with your donation, you understand that you are purchasing a voucher for a local community member to use at one of our participating merchants. Donations may be tax-deductible. Please see the campaign details for more information.

body.emailUpdates: I'd like to receive email updates from Send Chinatown Love, such as when the merchant receives my donation/purchase or when a new merchant is onboarded

description.body: We appreciate your support! 100% of your tax-deductible donation will be used to give back to the community in need. Campaign proceeds will be split evenly amongst the four participating merchants to ensure equal relief goes to our partners.
description.targetNotMet: All contributions will be matched 1:1 up until {{targetAmount}} is raised, doubling your impact on those in need.
description.targetMet: We’re excited to announce that our donation match threshold has been hit! While donations will no longer be doubled, we encourage you to still support the cause. Every donation, no matter how big or small, goes a long way in feeding the hungry.

lightUpChinatown.headerSubtext: Let’s light up Chinatown, one lantern at a time.
lightUpChinatown.summaryBody1: Chinatown was hit hardest as fears about the coronavirus circulated in the United States in late January. Rumors swirled about the virus being present in Chinatown, and as xenophobia grew, restaurants’ revenue steeply declined. Without the regular volume of customers and foot traffic in Chinatown, the future of its many small, immigrant-owned businesses seemed bleak.
lightUpChinatown.summaryBody2: Patrick Mock, manager of 46 Mott St Bakery and community advocate, had an idea to light up Chinatown streets to draw customers back to Chinatown. With the help of City Council District 1 candidate Jenny Low, Chung Seto of United Democratic Organization (UDO), Joanne Kwong of Pearl River Mart and Send Chinatown Love, the <1>Light Up Chinatown</1> project was born.
lightUpChinatown.summaryBody3: Support the Light Up Chinatown project by donating today where all proceeds will go towards installing permanent light fixtures and traditional lanterns in the neighborhood.
lightUpChinatown.summaryBody4: Help us show that Chinatown is open for business and light the path forward for the neighborhood’s small business owners. Donate to Light Up Chinatown today.
lightUpChinatown.summaryBody5: We are extending the campaign time and are still accepting donations. We are no longer accepting lantern requests as we reached the maximum lantern amount. Thank you all to those who are supporting this project!
lightUpChinatown.ceremony1: Our big reveal of “Light Up Chinatown” is planned for the second week of December in celebration of the Winter Solstice. We hope you and your family will join us for this festive evening. Together, we can find light in the darkness.
lightUpChinatown.ceremony2: When you make a lantern donation, you will receive an email once we finalize the date and time.
lightUpChinatown.donationDescription1: 100% of the donations, no matter how big or small, will go towards permanent light fixtures and lanterns throughout Chinatown.
lightUpChinatown.donationDescription2: If you donate more than ${{limit_1}}, you will be eligible to participate in “Adopt-a-Lantern” where you will receive some perks for your generous donation.
lightUpChinatown.faqQuestion1: How will my donation for this project benefit Chinatown?
lightUpChinatown.faqAnswer1: Your donation will help permanently light up Chinatown streets, ensuring  consistent foot traffic to support Chinatown’s small businesses. If you had participated in our “Adopt-a-Lantern” and donated $150 or more, you will receive a lantern and invitation to the “Light Up Chinatown” Ceremony.
lightUpChinatown.faqQuestion2: What is the “Light Up Chinatown” Ceremony?
lightUpChinatown.faqAnswer2: In celebration of the Winter Solstice, there will be an all-day event in Chinatown to honor the start of the season and a “Light Up Chinatown” Ceremony. During the celebration, all are welcome to enjoy delicious food and holiday shopping. Invitations with exact details will be sent to those who donated $150+ to our Light Up Chinatown Fundraising Campaign. The lights will be installed and available for viewing on December 23th.
lightUpChinatown.faqQuestion3: How will the light fixtures and lanterns be installed for “Light Up Chinatown”?
lightUpChinatown.faqAnswer3: <0>Alternative Earth Care</0> has a four man team that will install 14 sections of lighting on Mott Street from Canal to Bayard with lanterns hung between each light bulb for Light Up Chinatown.
lightUpChinatown.faqQuestion4: I donated $150+ before December 15th, where can I pick up my personalized lantern?
lightUpChinatown.faqAnswer4: The pick up location for lanterns will be at Pearl River Mart on 395 Broadway, New York, NY 10013 after December 26th anytime from 11am - 6pm. You should have received an email confirmation with detailed instructions on pick up. If you provided your shipping address, we will ship you your personalized lantern after December 21st.
lightUpChinatown.faqQuestion5: I have not received an email confirmation. Who can I contact?
lightUpChinatown.faqAnswer5: Please contact us at <0>hello@sendchinatownlove.com</0> with the subject line “Light Up Chinatown”.
lightUpChinatown.faqQuestion6: I love Chinatown and I’d love to further support its businesses. Where can I do that?
lightUpChinatown.faqAnswer6: Thank you for sharing your love with Chinatown! To continue supporting this community, check out our <0>merchant page</0> for the full list of Asian-owned businesses we’re working with. From here, you can make a donation or buy a gift card.
lightUpChinatown.faqAnswer7: Send Chinatown Love is a New York-based, entirely volunteer-run organization that helps the Chinatowns across the city get back on their feet The goal of Send Chinatown Love is to uplift  Asian and immigrant-owned small businesses by providing donations and personalized business development support.
lightUpChinatown.donationDetail1: 1 x 14-inch lantern with your personalization hung on Mott Street
lightUpChinatown.donationDetail2: Funding permanent light fixtures throughout Chinatown
lightUpChinatown.donationDetail3: 1 x 14-inch lantern with your personalization hung on Mott Street
lightUpChinatown.donationDetail4: 1 x 12-inch custom designed lantern by a local artist to take home with you
lightUpChinatown.donationDetail5: *A limited number of invitations to our Winter Solstice Celebration and lighting ceremony in December will be given to our largest donors
lightUpChinatown.goal1: Permanent light fixtures and lanterns on Mott St from Canal St to Bayard St
lightUpChinatown.goal2: Permanent light fixtures on Bayard St from Mott St to Bowery St
lightUpChinatown.partnerThanks: Thank you to our Chinatown Partners who make this possible!
lightUpChinatown.goalReachedtitle: Thank you for helping us reach our goal!
lightUpChinatown.goalReachedDescription1: We have closed our campaign but you can continue to support the Light Up Chinatown project at CCBA and Chinese Chamber of Commerce GoFundMe page. Please keep an eye out on our Instagram as we install the lanterns and lights on Mott and Bayard Street. We appreciate our community’s never-ending support in helping us drive foot traffic back into Chinatown!
lightUpChinatown.goalReachedDescription2: You can also continue to support our Send Chinatown Love businesses and causes at our Ways to Donate page.

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: When is the Lunar New Year Crawl?
What is the Lunar New Year Crawl?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: Send Chinatown Love is hosting a Lunar New Year (LNY) Crawl in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens to celebrate the special holiday. This event highlights 33+ vendors, ranging from gift shops to restaurants, to encourage communities to shop at local Asian-owned businesses in celebration of Lunar New Year! Participants can also shop for their LNY must-haves to prepare for their own celebrations, whether they need decorations or traditional dishes to complete their LNY spread.<5/> Designed to be as flexible as possible, the LNY Crawl is a unique way to discover and interact with amazing shops, restaurants, bakeries, and more in your own backyard!

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: Which vendors are participating?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: We have 29 vendors ranging from gift shops to restaurants that are spread across Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens. Check out the full list at <4>https://www.sendchinatownlove.com/lny-crawl.html/</4>

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: What is the purpose of the Lunar New Year Crawl?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: The goal of this event is to encourage people to explore locally while helping to bring some much needed support to small business owners who need it most.<5/>In 2020, most Chinatowns across the nation noted a large decline in business due to COVID-19 related xenophobia. Beginning as early as January 2020, these communities missed out on significant business from Lunar New Year celebrations, with the majority entering the subsequent lockdowns at a financial deficit that set a dire precedent for the year to come.<5/>Lunar New Year represents one of the most joyous and festive times of year for the Chinatowns across New York City. We hope to keep that spirit alive.

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: How can I participate in the LNY Crawl?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: From digital donations to take-out receipts, there are many ways to participate in the Crawl, even if you don’t live in New York! <5/> To make this event as accessible and COVID-safe as possible, you can either: (1) order take-out, (2) order delivery, (3) dine-in where available, or (4) donate to our merchants or our Gift-a-Meal campaigns at <3>www.sendchinatownlove.com</3><5/> Once you've made a purchase, upload or take a picture of your receipt using your <6>Passport to Lunar New Year</6><5/> Collect 3 receipts or provide 3 donations from different vendors to get a raffle ticket! You can use this raffle ticket to enter into one of our giveaway baskets.

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: I didn’t get a receipt / lost my receipt. Can I still log my purchase into my <1>Passport to Lunar New Year? </1>
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: Yes! If you don’t have a receipt, you can either: 1) take a screenshot of your purchase on your card statement, or 2) take a picture of your food / item purchase. This is still valid and will count towards earning a raffle ticket for giveaways.

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: I don’t live in NYC but still want to support local businesses. Can I still participate in the LNY Crawl?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: Yes! If you can’t make it to one of our featured vendors, you can donate to any of our initiatives on <3>www.sendchinatownlove.com</3>. You can choose to donate to 1) merchants directly, 2) to a donation pool to have your funds evenly distributed among all our merchants, 3) or to our Gift-A-Meal program, where we work with merchants and local organizations to distribute meals to community members in need. Once you donate, your <1>Passport to Lunar New Year</1> will automatically update with a stamp, which you can collect to earn a raffle ticket to enter into our giveaway baskets.<5/>Be sure to use the same email for both your <1>Passport</1> and your donation(s)!

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: What do I get for participating?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: Not only will you be supporting local businesses and finding new local favorites, but you’ll also be entering for a chance to win one of our giveaway baskets.

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: How do I enter the giveaway?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: Winners of the giveaways will be drawn at the end of the month (February 2021). Once you collect 3 receipts from different LNY Crawl vendors (or make a donation on Send Chinatown Love’s website), you will earn 1 raffle ticket. You can use this raffle ticket as 1 entry towards the giveaway basket of your choice.<5/>You have unlimited entries and can collect as many receipts, (or provide as many donations), as you want!

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: How do I get a raffle ticket?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: Purchase a meal or item from any of our featured vendors, or make a donation of your choice on Send Chinatown Love’s website.<5/>  Make a purchase or make a donation of at least $5 USD.<5/> Upload a photo of your receipt from in-person purchases or takeout orders to your <1>Passport to Lunar New Year</1>. <5/> Collect 3 receipts from different vendors (or make donations), and you’ll get a raffle ticket in your <1>Passport</1>, allowing you to enter into the giveaway basket of your choice!

arrayOfQuestionAnswers.question: What is the Passport to <1>Lunar New Year</1>, and how do I use it?
arrayOfQuestionAnswers.answer: This is a mobile site built by our team where you can log your receipts for all of the vendors you support! Each time you collect a receipt, add it to your <1>Passport to Lunar New Year</1> by uploading a photo of the receipt. The more receipts you collect, the more chances you have to win giveaways! Once you’ve collected three receipts, you can use your <1>Passport</1> to enter into the giveaway basket of your choice.
